name: Donut Ice Cream Sandwiches
ingredients: 1/2 cup butter pean ice cream, slightly softened
instructions:
1. Cut maple bacon bar in half, then cut each piece in half horizontally.
2. Spread the bottom of each bar donut half with butter pecan ice cream.
3. Place the cut donut tops onto the ice cream.
4. Serve immediately.

name: Mamon (Sponge Cakes)
instructions:
1. Stir the flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.
2. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and add the oil, egg yolks, grated orange peel, vanilla extract, orange juice, and water.
3. Mix well by hand until smooth with no lumps.
4. Beat the egg whites with the cream of tartar until foamy in a large glass or metal mixing bowl.
5. Gradually add the 1/2 cup sugar, continuing to beat until soft peaks form.
6. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the egg whites will form soft mounds rather than a sharp peak. Fold the flour mixture into the egg whites.
7. Pour the resulting batter into the prepared muffin cups to about 2/3 full.
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes.
9. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.

name: Fruit Salad
instructions:
1. For the sauce: Bring orange juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, orange zest, and lemon zest to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. 
2. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
3. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Set aside to cool.
4. For the salad: Layer fruit in a large, clear glass bowl in this order: pineapple, strawberries, kiwi fruit, bananas, oranges, grapes, and blueberries.
5.  Pour cooled sauce over fruit; cover and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours before serving.

name: Cheese Ball
instructions:
1. Beat cream cheese until smooth, and then mix in the remaining ingredients. 
2. Remember that high quality ingredients make a high quality cheese ball. 
3. Use a spatula and your hands to form the mixture into a ball.
4. Be sure to spray your hands with non-stick cooking spray to prevent the cheese from sticking.
5. You can use whatever type of nuts you prefer, just be sure to chop them finely.
6. To coat in nuts, hold the cheese ball in one hand and use your other hand to gently scoop the chopped nuts and press them onto the ball.
7. Wrap the cheeseball in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.
